alert_name: Mass Data Exfiltration to TOR Hidden Service
description: Critical data exfiltration activity detected on file server FS-PROD-01 (10.50.20.10) 82 minutes after discovery phase. The Medusa threat actor exfiltrated 47.3GB of sensitive corporate data to TOR hidden service medusakxxtp3uo7vusntvubnytaph4d3amxivbggl3hnhpk2nmus34yd.onion (Medusa ransomware leak site infrastructure). Exfiltration occurred over encrypted HTTPS connection via TOR proxy running on compromised host. Data staged in C:\Windows\Temp\export\ directory included: (1) Financial records - 12.4GB (Excel spreadsheets, QuickBooks databases), (2) Customer PII database - 8.7GB (SQL dumps with 2.3M customer records), (3) Source code repositories - 15.2GB (proprietary software), (4) Executive email archives - 11GB (Outlook PST files). The attacker used custom Python-based exfiltration tool (rclone.exe renamed to svchost32.exe) with compression and encryption. Network traffic analysis shows sustained 85Mbps upload for 78 minutes. This double-extortion tactic enables Medusa operators to publish stolen data on their leak site if ransom demands are not met, as documented in Unit 42 Medusa intelligence report.
policy_description: Mass data exfiltration to Medusa ransomware leak site - double extortion
policy_recommendation: Block TOR traffic immediately, kill exfiltration processes, delete staged data in C:\Windows\Temp\export, contact legal counsel regarding data breach notification requirements (2.3M customer records), monitor Medusa Blog leak site for publication, prepare for ransom negotiation or data exposure, notify affected customers per GDPR/CCPA requirements
mitre_att&ck_technique: T1048.002 - Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol: Exfiltration Over Asymmetric Encrypted Non-C2 Protocol
